pr_title: Add support for the varchar with the length limit in CrateDB parser and analyzer.

timeline.bodyText: I think we can get rid of ColumnType and its derived classes and just for a string that represents the data type, then   in the analyzer we can use the type parameter signature parsing logic to get a CrateDB internal data type. I'll check that and follow up on it if it is possible after adding the varchar(length) support.
timeline.author: kovrus

timeline.bodyText: If we keep the grammar as is (dataType '('...) I think we should also add tests for the array and object cases
timeline.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: yes, it must be only for definedDataType and ident
replies.author: kovrus

timeline.bodyText: Maybe instead of switching to a LinkedHashSet we could sort the types inside the throws block. That we we'd only pay the price in the error case instead of all the time.
timeline.author: mfussenegger

timeline.bodyText: Maybe have a of overload for StringType that takes a list and move the validation there? Seems to me that the StringType should be responsible for knowing valid parameters, not DataTypes.
timeline.author: mfussenegger

timeline.message: Add parser support for varchar parametrization with length limit.
Add the length limit field to the crate string type.
Add varchar with length limit support in create table analyzer.
Add varchar with length limit support in create table analyzer.
